title: Boers
summary: Boers (/bʊərz/ BOORZ; Afrikaans: Boere) are the descendants of the Dutch-speaking Free Burghers of the eastern Cape frontier[2] in Southern Africa during the 17th, 18th, and 19th centuries. From 1652 to 1795, the Dutch East India Company controlled this area, but the United Kingdom incorporated it into the British Empire in 1806.[3] The name of the group is derived from "boer," which means "farmer" in Dutch and Afrikaans.[4]
